en: The Trails and Travails of the 20th Armored Division
Route map with a few cartoons
The Trails and Travails of the 20th Armored Division -- Munich (Germany)
The Trails and Travails of the 20th Armored Division -- Salzburg (Austria)
Canvas for The Trails and Travails of the 20th Armored Division

body.value:
Comical "Time Table" for unit's activities in Europe:

6 Feb - We Sail!

18 Feb - We Arrive!

10 April - We Cross the Rhine

28 April - We Cross the Danube

30 April - Munich: 'The 20th Armored Division Roars in from the West'

4 May - Salzburg: The End of the Road
Crossing from south coast of England to Le Havre. Cartoon of ships (the Barry and the Brazil) and a mermaid holding the division crest.
Humerous cartoon of the unit advancing from Le Havre to Cambrai.  Something may have happened near Amiens, because a tank is depicting losing its tracks.

Cartoon depicting the unit crossing into Germany.  Sign reading "You Are Now Entering Germany," with an arrow below it pointing back into France reading "Fraternization."

Small image of an American jeep.  Self-propelled gun firing across the Rhine.  Bridge south of Bonn.
Cartoon of German bomber, labelled "Bed Check Charlie"
Humerous image of Hitler watching anxiously from Berlin
Depiction of the assault across the Danube and the division's arrival in Munich.  German soldiers surrendering.

Cartoon of an American soldier raising the American flag above Salzburg.  Another American soldier smiles while he lies down in the shade of a tree with his helmet off and his rifle lying next to him.
Compass rose for division maps.  Soldier in red with explosion behind him.

seo.title: The Trails and Travails of the 20th Armored Division - World War II Service Maps
